channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Remarks made at Trump rally backfires. And, Yankees aim for World Series comeback
item.description: Harris’ plan for Puerto Rico's economy boosted after racist remarks made at Trump rally last night. And, the Yankees look for a World Series comeback after losing the first two games to the Dodgers.
item.content:encoded:
Harris’ plan for Puerto Rico's economy boosted after racist remarks made at Trump rally last night. And, the Yankees look for a World Series comeback after losing the first two games to the Dodgers.

(Image credit: Michael M. Santiago)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Here's where Harris and Trump stand on three big health care issues
item.description: The next president will face decisions on drug price negotiations, enhanced subsidies for Affordable Care Act plans and medication abortion among other issues. Here's where the candidates stand.
item.content:encoded:
The next president will face decisions on drug price negotiations, enhanced subsidies for Affordable Care Act plans and medication abortion among other issues. Here's where the candidates stand.

(Image credit: Charles Rex Arbogast)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Levi

item.title: At the heart of the Boeing strike, an emotional fight over a lost pension plan
item.description: Pensions are a major sticking point between Boeing and its striking machinists union. Many workers want the company to restore the pension plan they lost a decade ago, but Boeing hasn’t budged.
item.content:encoded:
Pensions are a major sticking point between Boeing and its striking machinists union. Many workers want the company to restore the pension plan they lost a decade ago, but Boeing hasn’t budged.

(Image credit: Lindsey Wasson)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: 'We need you': Fewer Black men are enrolling in HBCUs. Here's what is lost
item.description: The absolute number of Black men enrolled at Historically Black Colleges and Universities is the lowest it's been since 1976.
item.content:encoded:
The absolute number of Black men enrolled at Historically Black Colleges and Universities is the lowest it's been since 1976.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers

item.title: Trump panned the CHIPS Act. Harris is in Michigan promoting it
item.description: In the waning days of the 2024 presidential election, even the bipartisan bill that's pouring $54 billion into the semiconductor manufacturing industry has become a political issue.
item.content:encoded:
In the waning days of the 2024 presidential election, even the bipartisan bill that's pouring $54 billion into the semiconductor manufacturing industry has become a political issue.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb)
item.dc:creator: Asma Khalid

item.title: Pennsylvania voters are complicated. We drove around the state to talking to them
item.description: Two Morning Edition teams drove hundreds of miles around the state to gauge how residents in this critical swing state feel about VP Harris and former President Donald Trump. Here’s what they told us.
item.content:encoded:
Two Morning Edition teams drove hundreds of miles around the state to gauge how residents in this critical swing state feel about VP Harris and former President Donald Trump. Here’s what they told us.

(Image credit: Nate Smallwood for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Obed Manuel

item.title: A transit worker gave Donald an unexpected gift: a hug from his son
item.description: A transit worker watched Donald Kabara and his son hug goodbye. Later, he was pleasantly surprised to see his son return with another hug — prompted by the worker.
item.content:encoded:
A transit worker watched Donald Kabara and his son hug goodbye. Later, he was pleasantly surprised to see his son return with another hug — prompted by the worker.

(Image credit: Donald Kabara)
item.dc:creator: Laura Kwerel

item.title: More than 150 dead or missing from massive flooding and landslides in the Philippines
item.description: Talisay, about 43 miles south of Manila, was one of several towns ravaged by Tropical Storm Trami, the deadliest of 11 storms to hit the Philippines this year.
item.content:encoded:
Talisay, about 43 miles south of Manila, was one of several towns ravaged by Tropical Storm Trami, the deadliest of 11 storms to hit the Philippines this year.

(Image credit: Aaron Favila/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: McDonald's will begin selling its Quarter Pounders again amid E. coli outbreak
item.description: McDonald’s says Quarter Pounders will return to its menu at all of its restaurants after it said testing ruled out beef patties as the source of an E. coli poisoning outbreak tied to the burgers.
item.content:encoded:
McDonald’s says Quarter Pounders will return to its menu at all of its restaurants after it said testing ruled out beef patties as the source of an E. coli poisoning outbreak tied to the burgers.

(Image credit: Michael M. Santiago)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: Schools in Asheville are reopening in the aftermath of Hurricane Helene
item.description: After-school activities will still be suspended Monday and Tuesday.
item.content:encoded:
After-school activities will still be suspended Monday and Tuesday.

(Image credit: Makiya Seminera)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie
